column4: maybe you need to install libsdl1.2debian-esd, that works for me for those games that require me to quit esd.  (assuming you are running gnome).
um... that's in the universe repo.

Binks: that is strange.  I had this problem when I tried playing Cube or Tuxracer when most of the forums gave advice on quitting esd "to get sound".  I got fed up of quitting esd everytime so I installed the SDL with esd support.
that seems to be the closest scenario that you described (everything else has sound only ET doesn't).
yes. Explain what you did to sort it lol
then what thirso, or is that work?
Binks: sorry, gtg. better luck with the others.
